abstract.original_text: The remaining early transcription units are all transcriptionally activated by E1A and encode for 63 products of related function. The E2 region on the reverse strand of the AdV genome has both an 64 early and a late promoter, as well as two distinct polyadenylation sites, leading to upstream E2A 65 and downstream E2B transcripts [24]. E2A encodes for the viral DNA-binding protein (DBP), while 66 alternative splicing to E2B encodes for the protein-priming terminal protein (pTP) as well as the 67
